intro: Pulsatilla alpina subsp. schneebergensis, commonly known as the Schneeberg anemone, is a rare alpine plant native to Central Europe. It is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It has a rosette of basal leaves that are hairy and often covered in a waxy coating. This subspecies is closely related to other members of the Ranunculaceae family and is noted for its ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
